hypothesis_content.title: Failed L2 Breakdown as Bullish Reversal Signal
hypothesis_content.statement: If a major L2 token (ARB) breaks below a key 30-day support level on low volume (<90% of 20-day avg) and reclaims that level within 48 hours, it signals a bear trap and will lead to a rapid mean reversion rally of at least +15% over the following 8 trading days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: A low-volume breakdown suggests a lack of committed selling. A swift reclaim indicates the move was a 'stop hunt' or liquidity grab. In a sector with positive narrative momentum (L2 breakout analysis in news), this failed bearish move often leads to a violent short squeeze and rally as weak hands are flushed out.
entry_conditions: Price breaks below a clear 30-day support/low
Breakdown volume is <90% of 20-day average volume
Price closes back above the broken support level within 2 trading days

exit_conditions.take_profit: 15% gain from the re-entry closing price (above support)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Close below the recent breakdown low

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: After a reclaim, price falls back below support and makes a new low more than 35% of the time, invalidating the bear trap thesis.
